alert.note: Alert for Yell (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 03 at 7:29PM CST until March 06 at 7:00PM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Arkansas... Petit Jean River At Danville affecting Yell County. Fourche Lafave River Near Gravelly affecting Yell County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arkansas... Fourche Lafave River Near Houston affecting Perry County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Petit Jean River At Danville. * WHEN...Until Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, Major flooding begins. Some low lying parts of Danville, residences and businesses in the flood plain, may be affected. Bailey Branch Road, East 13th Street, Corinth Road, and the industrial park near McCargo Branch flooded. State Highways 27 and 80 may be affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM CST Friday the stage was 27.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected expected to crest at 27.4 feet just after midnight on Saturday. It is then expected to fall below flood stage early Sunday afternoon and continue falling to 15.2 feet early Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 6 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Crest Time Date Petit Jean River Danville 20.0 27.1 Fri 6 PM 22.4 19.5 17.7 27.4 12 AM 3/4 &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
